description: The US could lead the operation of a nuclear plant in Ukraine “with very little problem” if the political decision is made to do so, according to Energy Secretary Chris Wright.
title: US Willing to Lead Ukraine Nuclear Plant, Energy Secretary Says

description: President Donald Trump said he would withdraw an executive order stripping security clearances and threatening government contracts from Paul Weiss after the powerhouse firm agreed not to use diversity and inclusion considerations in its hiring practices and donate $40 million in pro bono legal services to initiatives supported by his administration.
title: Trump Withdrawing Paul Weiss Order After $40 Million Agreement

description: Aaron Kofsky, a former staffer to then-Senator JD Vance, has joined the Federal Housing Finance Agency and is tasked with helping to overhaul its structure and workforce, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Ex-Vance Staffer Kofsky Joins FHFA as Agency Eyes Job Cuts

description: European officials say the Trump administration has pared back its engagement with efforts to enforce sanctions on Russia as the US pushes for an end to the war in Ukraine.
title: Allies Say US Retreating From Push to Enforce Russia Sanctions

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner looks at the president’s actions to dismantle the Department of Education. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Cheers Activists With Order to Dismantle Education Department

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order to largely dismantle the Education Department — an organization created by Congress and tasked with sweeping responsibilities that involve billions in funds that impact millions of American students.
title: Trump Signs Order to Largely Dismantle Education Department

description: President Donald Trump said he would soon sign a natural-resources deal with Ukraine that would give the US partial control over revenue from future resource extraction.
title: Trump Says He’ll Soon Sign Ukraine Natural Resources Deal

description: The federal judge handling a lawsuit over the deportation of alleged Venezuelan gang members blasted the Trump administration’s latest filing as “woefully insufficient.”
title: Judge Calls US Filing ‘Woefully Insufficient’ in Venezuela Case

description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith rejected any constraints on oil and gas exports to the US in her first meeting with new Prime Minister Mark Carney, renewing her criticism of Canada’s Liberal government as the country prepares for an election.
title: Alberta Premier Rejects Oil Export Tax in Meeting With Carney

description: Not all of the hundreds of Venezuelans deported last weekend by the Trump administration are gang members, according to lawyers challenging the US move that whisked them out of the country.
title: Trump Deported Venezuelans Who Aren’t Gang Members, Lawyers Say

description: President Donald Trump is invoking emergency powers to boost the ability of the US to produce critical minerals — and potentially coal — as part of a broad effort to ramp up the development of domestic natural resources and make the country less reliant on foreign imports.
title: Trump to Expand Critical Mineral Production Using Wartime Powers

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer is focusing a post-war European military guarantee for Ukraine on air and sea support, moving away from his previous priority of securing troops on the ground to enforce any peace deal with Russia.
title: Starmer Shifts to Air Support for Ukraine as Troop Hopes Dwindle

description: Israel’s cabinet is set to approve Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s proposal to fire the country’s domestic intelligence chief late on Thursday, defying thousands of protesters rallying against his removal and those of other security and judicial officials.
title: Netanyahu’s Cabinet Set to Fire Shin Bet Chief, Defying Israeli Protesters

description: A Maryland federal judge temporarily blocked Elon Musk’s government efficiency team from accessing the personal information of potentially hundreds of millions of Americans who receive retirement payments and other benefits from the US government.
title: Judge Blocks DOGE Access to Social Security Records for Now

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said he’s canceling more than $580 million in programs that don’t align with President Donald Trump’s priorities, as part of his partnership with Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency.
title: Hegseth Touts Another $580 Million in DOGE-Led Pentagon Cuts

description: A US citizen detained by the Taliban in Afghanistan for more than two years has been released, as the Trump administration continues to exert pressure on foreign governments to release detained Americans, the State Department said Thursday.
title: Taliban Frees US Citizen Glezmann After More Than Two Years

description: European Union leaders tussled over weapons deliveries to Kyiv and who would represent them in US-led diplomacy as the bloc struggled to formulate a strategy on Ukraine.
title: EU’s Ukraine Talks Spark Fresh Tension in Face of Trump Pressure

description: Leaders from European countries will meet in Paris next week to discuss their position on Ukraine and demands on the peace process, according to people familiar with the plans.
title: European Leaders to Meet in Paris Next Week to Discuss Ukraine

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez will travel to China next month to meet with President Xi Jinping, according to people familiar with the preparations.
title: Spanish Premier Sanchez to Meet Xi in China Next Month

description: Bosnia-Herzegovina was added to the agenda at a European Union summit as alarm among leaders mounted that a potential disintegration of the war-scarred Balkan nation could unleash turmoil in southeastern Europe.
title: Bosnia Climbs Up EU Agenda as Serb Secession Talk Stokes Worry

description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy ruled out ceding control of Ukraine’s nuclear power plants, but left open the possibility of the US investing in them following a phone call with Donald Trump.
title: Zelenskiy Says Open to US Investing in Nuclear Plants

description: Donald Trump rehashed the crypto-supportive actions taken by his administration since he returned to the US presidency and reiterated support for stablecoin legislation, saying it will help expand the dollar’s dominance.
title: Trump Reiterates Support for Crypto, Stablecoin Legislation

description: South Africa’s presidency asked Johannesburg to exercise restraint on plans to rename the street where the US consulate is located after a Palestinian woman who hijacked an American airliner as it seeks to mend frayed ties with Washington.
title: South Africa Urges Rethink on Naming US Office Road for Hijacker

description: Los Angeles is facing a projected deficit of nearly $1 billion in the next fiscal year as the city grapples with the aftermath of historic wildfires and a deep decline in revenue.
title: LA Faces $1 Billion Budget Hole, Warns of Thousands of Layoffs

description: A US citizen detained by the Taliban in Afghanistan for more than two years has been released, as the Trump administration continues to exert pressure on foreign governments to release detained Americans, the State Department said Thursday.
title: Taliban Frees US Citizen Glezmann After More Than Two Years

description: An effort by European Union leaders to deliver €5 billion ($5.4 billion) to secure ammunition for Ukraine this year was held up by France and Italy, European diplomats said, another sign of the challenges the bloc faces in replacing US support for Kyiv.
title: France and Italy Stall EU Push to Commit Ammunition for Ukraine

description: French President Emmanuel Macron’s plan to attract more private equity firms to Paris has been hampered by the country’s political turmoil, a senior JPMorgan Chase & Co. executive said Thursday.
title: Macron Lost Private Equity ‘Battle,’ JPMorgan Executive Says

description: Nigerian legislators supported President Bola Tinubu’s imposition of a state of emergency in a key oil-producing state where crude pipelines were damaged in a couple of attacks.
title: Nigeria Lawmakers Back Tinubu’s Emergency Rule in Oil-Rich State

description: Former Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon was cleared by police investigating the Scottish National Party’s finances as her estranged husband appeared in court charged with embezzlement.
title: Scotland’s Sturgeon Cleared by Police in SNP Finance Probe

description: The UK and India are “very close” to agreeing a long-awaited free trade agreement just weeks after the two countries restarted talks, a senior Indian diplomat said.
title: India Closes In on Long-Sought Free Trade Agreement With UK

description: The European Union is delaying its proposed 50% tariff on American whiskey until mid-April, aligning them with broader countermeasures against US steel and aluminum duties.
title: EU Delays 50% Tariffs on US Whiskey, Allowing for More Talks

description: Ethiopia may consider reshuffling the interim government in the volatile Tigray region where factional wrangling is threatening to reignite a conflict that could draw in neighboring Eritrea.
title: Ethiopia Premier Hints At Leadership Changes for Tigray Region

description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s escalation of the campaign against his most prominent political rival came at the expense of Turkey’s market stability.
title: Erdogan’s Foreign Policy Clout Sees Him Test Limits of Power

description: President Xi Jinping’s government is set to welcome a US senator close to Donald Trump, as the world’s largest economies try to move forward trade talks that have stalled at lower levels.
title: China to Welcome Trump-Aligned Senator With Trade Talks Stalled

description: The US has agreed to extend a sanction waiver, which would allow Turkey to continue buying Russian natural gas until May, according to a Turkish official with direct knowledge on the matter.
title: Turkey Says It Gets US Sanction Waiver Extension for Russian Gas

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Jakarta’s Strongman Risks Overplaying His Hand

description: Members of Venezuela’s opposition are trapped in an Argentine embassy, living on rainwater and sardines, as government forces stand watch.
title: The Yearlong Standoff Between Five Prisoners in a Mansion and Maduro's Regime

description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to call a snap federal election on Sunday for an expected vote on April 28, the Globe and Mail reported, citing two people familiar with the matter.
title: Carney Set to Call Canada Snap Election for April 28, Globe Says

description: Western allies will begin talks to hammer out the detailed military plans underpinning an Anglo-French-led peacekeeping force, stepping up preparations for postwar Ukraine despite Russian President Vladimir Putin’s rejection of a full ceasefire.
title: UK Spearheads Military Planning Discussions for Postwar Ukraine

description: Russia and Ukraine exchanged mass drone attacks overnight, even as the two countries declared they’re ready to observe a moratorium on strikes against energy infrastructure sought by US President Donald Trump.
title: Russia and Ukraine Keep Up Drone Attacks Amid Truce on Energy

description: China urged respect for its judicial sovereignty after Canada condemned the execution of four of its citizens, further straining ties between the two nations.
title: China Asks Canada to Respect Its Laws Following Executions

description: Digging into controversial law from the 1920s.
title: The Great Jones Act Debate

description: South Korea’s Constitutional Court is now set to rule Monday on whether to uphold Prime Minister Han Duck-soo’s impeachment motion, while they continue to deliberate on President Yoon Suk Yeol’s case following his shock martial law decree.
title: South Korean Court to Rule Monday on Impeached PM Han

description: The UK is planning to appoint more business figures to diplomatic roles as part of a new drive to diversify Britain’s trade and economic relationships.
title: UK Looks to Business for Diplomatic Recruits in Trade Push

description: The cost of borrowing Turkish liras in the offshore market rose to the highest in two years after Turkish authorities detained President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s main political rival on corruption charges on Wednesday.
title: Turkey Turmoil Pushes Lira Borrowing Costs to Highest in Years

description: US President Donald Trump said India will be hit by like-for-like duties from April 2, even as officials in New Delhi scurry to appease Washington by reducing trade barriers.
title: Trump Says India Will be Hit by Reciprocal Tariffs on April 2

description: Vietnam’s government is allowing 49% foreign ownership of a handful of banks — up from 30% — that have taken over struggling financial institutions in a move to quicken the central bank’s restructuring of troubled lenders.
title: Vietnam Now Allows 49% Foreign Ownership of Some Domestic Banks

description: European Union leaders will aim to affirm their plans to bolster defense spending at a summit Thursday, but now face a more pressing concern: whether they will have a role in US President Donald Trump’s efforts to fast-track a ceasefire in Ukraine.
title: EU Leaders to Grapple With Trump’s Russia Gambit: What to Watch

description: As President Donald Trump rattles US allies with his geopolitical maneuvers, the situation has helped one European leader return to the spotlight: Emmanuel Macron.
title: Macron Is Heading for a Clash With Trump Over His Push to Help Ukraine

description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro is close to naming Germán Ávila, the head of the country’s state-run banking group, as his next finance minister, according to a person familiar with the decision.
title: Colombia’s President Plans to Name Ávila Next Finance Minister

description: Indonesia passed legislation on Thursday expanding the role of Southeast Asia’s largest armed forces, altering some of the curbs installed two decades ago after the Suharto dictatorship and adding fresh questions about the country’s direction under President Prabowo Subianto.
title: Indonesia Expands Military’s Role Amid Backsliding Concerns

description: South Korean marriages increased the most on record in a hopeful sign for a nation that has been ramping up efforts to boost the world’s lowest fertility rate behind growing economic pessimism.
title: South Korea’s Marriages Jump, Offering Hopes for Aging Nation

description: President Donald Trump said the Federal Reserve should cut interest rates, splitting with the US central bank as officials weigh the economic cost of his tariff push.
title: Trump Says Fed Should Cut Rates as Tariff Push Heats Up

description: Australia’s opposition leader said he will make his first foreign visit to the US to meet with President Donald Trump if he wins the forthcoming election, arguing the longstanding allies must deepen their relationship despite simmering tensions with the new administration.
title: Australia’s Dutton Says Trump Meeting Will Be First If Elected

description: Freddie Mac told employees that they will be expected to work from the office five days a week beginning in May and promised to review compensation plans in an effort to reward key people.
title: Freddie Mac Tells Workers to Return to Office Full Time

description: India’s plan to expand one of the world’s largest coal power fleets in order to meet its growing energy needs is being undone by a shortage of companies able and willing to help build new plants.
title: Years of Coal Backlash Undermine India’s Energy Security Push

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer will “lay the keel” for the first in the next generation of the UK’s nuclear-armed submarines, in a symbolic gesture as concerns grow about the nation’s reliance on the US to maintain its arsenal.
title: Starmer Touts Nuclear Deterrent Amid Concerns Over US Backing
